meanings.definition: To inflict suffering or hardship upon
meanings.sent1: Bullying others can aggrieve them and make them feel sad.
meanings.sent2: The loss of her pet dog aggrieved her deeply.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat aggrieved the friendly dog by stealing its toy.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to aggrieve the once peaceful sky.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the song aggrieved her heart with sorrow.

meanings.sent1: Being late to the important meeting will aggrieve the boss.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise from the construction site aggrieved the residents.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel aggrieved the gardener by digging up the flowerbed.
meanings.sent4: The dark memories continued to aggrieve her mind like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected betrayal aggrieved him more than words could express.
